verses.verse: And when Rachel <WH7354> saw <WH7200> that she bare <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> no children, Rachel <WH7354> envied <WH7065> her sister <WH269>; and said <WH559> unto Jacob <WH3290>, Give <WH3051> me children <WH1121>, or else <WH369> I die <WH4191>.

And Jacob's <WH3290> anger <WH639> was kindled <WH2734> against Rachel <WH7354>: and he said <WH559>, Am I in God's <WH430> stead, who hath withheld <WH4513> from thee the fruit <WH6529> of the womb <WH990>?
And she said <WH559>, Behold my maid <WH519> Bilhah <WH1090>, go in <WH935> unto her; and she shall bear <WH3205> upon my knees <WH1290>, that I may also have children <WH1129> by her.
And she gave <WH5414> him Bilhah <WH1090> her handmaid <WH8198> to wife <WH802>: and Jacob <WH3290> went in <WH935> unto her.
And Bilhah <WH1090> conceived <WH2029>, and bare <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a son <WH1121>.

And Rachel <WH7354> said <WH559>, God <WH430> hath judged <WH1777> me, and hath also heard <WH8085> my voice <WH6963>, and hath given <WH5414> me a son <WH1121>: therefore called <WH7121> she his name <WH8034> Dan <WH1835>.
And Bilhah <WH1090> Rachel's <WH7354> maid <WH8198> conceived <WH2029> again, and bare <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a second <WH8145> son <WH1121>.

And Rachel <WH7354> said <WH559>, With great <WH430> wrestlings <WH5319> have I wrestled <WH6617> with my sister <WH269>, and I have prevailed <WH3201>: and she called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Naphtali <WH5321>.
When Leah <WH3812> saw <WH7200> that she had left <WH5975> bearing <WH3205>, she took <WH3947> Zilpah <WH2153> her maid <WH8198>, and gave <WH5414> her Jacob <WH3290> to wife <WH802>.
And Zilpah <WH2153> Leah's <WH3812> maid <WH8198> bare <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a son <WH1121>.
And Leah <WH3812> said <WH559>, A troop <WH1409> cometh <WH935>: and she called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Gad <WH1410>.
And Zilpah <WH2153> Leah's <WH3812> maid <WH8198> bare <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a second <WH8145> son <WH1121>.
And Leah <WH3812> said <WH559>, Happy am I <WH837>, for the daughters <WH1323> will call me blessed <WH833>: and she called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Asher <WH836>.

¶ And Reuben <WH7205> went in <WH3212> the days <WH3117> of wheat <WH2406> harvest <WH7105>, and found <WH4672> mandrakes <WH1736> in the field <WH7704>, and brought <WH935> them unto his mother <WH517> Leah <WH3812>. Then Rachel <WH7354> said <WH559> to Leah <WH3812>, Give me <WH5414>, I pray thee, of thy son's <WH1121> mandrakes <WH1736>.

And she said <WH559> unto her, Is it a small matter <WH4592> that thou hast taken <WH3947> my husband <WH376>? and wouldest thou take away <WH3947> my son's <WH1121> mandrakes <WH1736> also? And Rachel <WH7354> said <WH559>, Therefore he shall lie <WH7901> with thee to night <WH3915> for <WH8478> thy son's <WH1121> mandrakes <WH1736>.

And Jacob <WH3290> came <WH935> out of the field <WH7704> in the evening <WH6153>, and Leah <WH3812> went out <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> him, and said <WH559>, Thou must come in <WH935> unto me; for surely <WH7936> I have hired <WH7936> thee with my son's <WH1121> mandrakes <WH1736>. And he lay <WH7901> with her that night <WH3915>.
And God <WH430> hearkened <WH8085> unto Leah <WH3812>, and she conceived <WH2029>, and bare <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> the fifth <WH2549> son <WH1121>.

And Leah <WH3812> said <WH559>, God <WH430> hath given <WH5414> me my hire <WH7939>, because <WH834> I have given <WH5414> my maiden <WH8198> to my husband <WH376>: and she called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Issachar <WH3485>.
And Leah <WH3812> conceived <WH2029> again, and bare <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> the sixth <WH8345> son <WH1121>.

And Leah <WH3812> said <WH559>, God <WH430> hath endued <WH2064> me with a good <WH2896> dowry <WH2065>; now <WH6471> will my husband <WH376> dwell <WH2082> with me, because I have born <WH3205> him six <WH8337> sons <WH1121>: and she called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Zebulun <WH2074>.
And afterwards <WH310> she bare <WH3205> a daughter <WH1323>, and called <WH7121> her name <WH8034> Dinah <WH1783>.
¶ And God <WH430> remembered <WH2142> Rachel <WH7354>, and God <WH430> hearkened <WH8085> to her, and opened <WH6605> her womb <WH7358>.
And she conceived <WH2029>, and bare <WH3205> a son <WH1121>; and said <WH559>, God <WH430> hath taken away <WH622> my reproach <WH2781>:
And she called <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Joseph <WH3130>; and said <WH559>, The LORD <WH3068> shall add <WH3254> to me another <WH312> son <WH1121>.

¶ And it came to pass, when Rachel <WH7354> had born <WH3205> Joseph <WH3130>, that Jacob <WH3290> said <WH559> unto Laban <WH3837>, Send me away <WH7971>, that I may go <WH3212> unto mine own place <WH4725>, and to my country <WH776>.

Give <WH5414> me my wives <WH802> and my children <WH3206>, for <WH2004> whom I have served <WH5647> thee, and let me go <WH3212>: for thou knowest <WH3045> my service <WH5656> which I have done <WH5647> thee.

And Laban <WH3837> said <WH559> unto him, I pray thee, if I have found <WH4672> favour <WH2580> in thine eyes <WH5869>, tarry: for I have learned by experience <WH5172> that the LORD <WH3068> hath blessed <WH1288> me for thy sake <WH1558>.
And he said <WH559>, Appoint <WH5344> me thy wages <WH7939>, and I will give <WH5414> it.
And he said <WH559> unto him, Thou knowest <WH3045> how <WH834> I have served <WH5647> thee, and how <WH834> thy cattle <WH4735> was with me.

For it was little <WH4592> which thou hadst before I <WH6440> came, and it is now increased <WH6555> unto a multitude <WH7230>; and the LORD <WH3068> hath blessed <WH1288> thee since my coming <WH7272>: and now when <WH4970> shall I provide <WH6213> for mine own house <WH1004> also?

And he said <WH559>, What shall I give thee <WH5414>? And Jacob <WH3290> said <WH559>, Thou shalt not give <WH5414> me any thing <WH3972>: if thou wilt do <WH6213> this thing <WH1697> for me, I will again <WH7725> feed <WH7462> and keep <WH8104> thy flock <WH6629>:

I will pass <WH5674> through all thy flock <WH6629> to day <WH3117>, removing <WH5493> from thence all the speckled <WH5348> and spotted <WH2921> cattle <WH7716>, and all the brown <WH2345> cattle <WH7716> among the sheep <WH3775>, and the spotted <WH2921> and speckled <WH5348> among the goats <WH5795>: and of such shall be my hire <WH7939>.

So shall my righteousness <WH6666> answer <WH6030> for me in time <WH3117> to come <WH4279>, when it shall come <WH935> for my hire <WH7939> before thy face <WH6440>: every one <WH3605> that is not speckled <WH5348> and spotted <WH2921> among the goats <WH5795>, and brown <WH2345> among the sheep <WH3775>, that shall be counted stolen <WH1589> with me.
And Laban <WH3837> said <WH559>, Behold, I would it might be <WH3863> according to thy word <WH1697>.

And he removed <WH5493> that day <WH3117> the he goats <WH8495> that were ringstraked <WH6124> and spotted <WH2921>, and all the she goats <WH5795> that were speckled <WH5348> and spotted <WH2921>, and every one that had some white <WH3836> in it, and all the brown <WH2345> among the sheep <WH3775>, and gave <WH5414> them into the hand <WH3027> of his sons <WH1121>.
And he set <WH7760> three <WH7969> days' <WH3117> journey <WH1870> betwixt himself and Jacob <WH3290>: and Jacob <WH3290> fed <WH7462> the rest <WH3498> of Laban's <WH3837> flocks <WH6629>.

¶ And Jacob <WH3290> took <WH3947> him rods <WH4731> of green <WH3892> poplar <WH3839>, and of the hazel <WH3869> and chesnut tree <WH6196>; and pilled <WH6478> white <WH3836> strakes <WH6479> in them, and made the white <WH3836> appear <WH4286> which was in the rods <WH4731>.

And he set <WH3322> the rods <WH4731> which he had pilled <WH6478> before <WH5227> the flocks <WH6629> in the gutters <WH7298> in the watering <WH4325> troughs <WH8268> when the flocks <WH6629> came <WH935> to drink <WH8354>, that they should conceive <WH3179> when they came <WH935> to drink <WH8354>.
And the flocks <WH6629> conceived <WH3179> before the rods <WH4731>, and brought forth <WH3205> cattle <WH6629> ringstraked <WH6124>, speckled <WH5348>, and spotted <WH2921>.

And Jacob <WH3290> did separate <WH6504> the lambs <WH3775>, and set <WH5414> the faces <WH6440> of the flocks <WH6629> toward <WH413> the ringstraked <WH6124>, and all the brown <WH2345> in the flock <WH6629> of Laban <WH3837>; and he put <WH7896> his own flocks <WH5739> by themselves, and put <WH7896> them not unto Laban's <WH3837> cattle <WH6629>.

And it came to pass, whensoever the stronger <WH7194> cattle <WH6629> did conceive <WH3179>, that Jacob <WH3290> laid <WH7760> the rods <WH4731> before the eyes <WH5869> of the cattle <WH6629> in the gutters <WH7298>, that they might conceive <WH3179> among the rods <WH4731>.
But when the cattle <WH6629> were feeble <WH5848>, he put them not in <WH7760>: so the feebler <WH5848> were Laban's <WH3837>, and the stronger <WH7194> Jacob's <WH3290>.

And the man <WH376> increased <WH6555> exceedingly <WH3966> <WH3966>, and had much <WH7227> cattle <WH6629>, and maidservants <WH8198>, and menservants <WH5650>, and camels <WH1581>, and asses <WH2543>.
